title: Debra Elmegreen - Wikipedia
snippet: Debra Meloy Elmegreen (born November 23, 1952 in South Bend, Indiana) is an American astronomer. She was the first woman to graduate from Princeton University with a degree in astrophysics, and she was the first female post-doctoral researcher at the Carnegie Observatories.

title: Debra Elmegreen - Poughkeepsie, New York, United States | Professional Profile | LinkedIn
snippet: Past President, International Astronomical Union; Professor Emerita of Astronomy, Vassar College · Debra Meloy Elmegreen was Professor of Astronomy on the Maria Mitchell Chair in the Department of Physics and Astronomy for 37 years and is now Professor Emerita.

title: Debra Meloy Elmegreen ￼
snippet: Dr. Elmegreen is Professor of Astronomy on the Maria Mitchell Chair and Chair of the Department of Physics and Astronomy at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, New York. She has been a member of the faculty since 1985. Her research interests include structure, interactions, and star formation in galaxies in the local universe and at high redshift.

title: Debra Elmegreen - Society for Science
snippet: Barrier-breaking astrophysicist Debra Elmegreen competed in the 1971 STS and 1970 ISEF. In her career, she has served as a professor of astronomy at Vassar College and president of the International Astronomical Union and American Astronomical Society. She and her husband study galaxy evolution and discovered Little Blue Dots, a new type of galaxy.
